intro: Psychotria crassa f. angustior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that contain the seeds. This species is often found in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
